summary: Currently pursuing a BA in International Studies, with a specific focus on the region of Europe, from Leiden University. Fluent in English and Hindi, and seeking to improve my French. Research interests include law with relation to the post-colonial legacies, conflict and humanitarian intervention, and art with relation to post-political research. Experienced in administration, event coordination and communication related with the university student body through study associations (like BASIS). I have experience in volunteering, and working at non-profit organisations, such as UNICEF Nederland. Skills include but aren’t limited to content writing, designing and social media, organisation and scheduling, public speaking.

awards.title: Champion Scholar
awards.description: While in high school, I participated in the World Scholars Cup competition in a team of 3. There were three rounds - regional (in Delhi), global (in Athens, Greece) and the round of champions (at Yale University). It started with over 20,000 participants in the regional rounds all over the world, and was narrowed down to 1000 students at the final round. I was among those. Areas of competition included debate, creative writing, quizzes (written and buzzer based) on an extensive syllabus of history, science, social science, literature, art and music, mythology. I won various awards in all three rounds. In the regional round: 14th place in the Scholars’ Bowl, 13th place as a Writing Champion, Honorary Medal in the categories of Champion Teams, Challenge History, Top Writing Teams, Top Challenge Teams. In the global round: 4th place in South Asia Top Teams, 22nd as a Top Debate Team, 1st place as a Top Writing Team, 23rd as an overall Champion Team, 7th as a South Asia Top Scholar, and 7th as a Writing Champion (among other medals). In the Yale round: In the Top 50 candidates or teams for most categories, received various honour medals for subject based performances.

profile_positions.description: I work on mainly 2 projects on different aspects such as logistics, coordination, promotion, collating materials, sponsorships, partnerships, events etc. These two projects are: first, Project COMET conducted in collaboration with the EU and the UNHCR, which is a project focused on building safe pathways for young refugees to enter, study, work and reside in Europe without feeling social/financial insecurity. The second project is Samen Hier x Student Community which is aimed at facilitating community building for newcomer (refugee) youth in the Netherlands through connecting them with students in Dutch cities who help with the often difficult process of settling into a new country.
profile_positions.title: Volunteer/Project Assistant

profile_positions.description:
- Contributing to increasing the uptake of nature-based solutions in Europe. 
- Research focused on agroecology as a method to integrate nature-based solutions into agricultural policy at the domestic and supranational level within the EU.
- Analysed and reviewed volumes of literature about the hinderances to the uptake of NbS in different spheres (political, economic, social, cultural), analysed various case studies and their agricultural sector, conducted extensive research also through interviews and proposed possible solutions and methods of applying agroecology to representatives of IUCN through a thorough report (at a length of 140 pages) and a presentation to summarise our findings.
profile_positions.title: Academic Consultant at International Union for Conservation of Nature

profile_positions.description:
- Organised a weekend away for First Year and Second Year students at Leiden University in the Dutch countryside.
- Managed all logistics (transport, food, activities, accommodation) and finances ourselves for 100 students in each weekend
- Managing the volunteers who help the committee.
- Planned activities and made a schedule for the 3 days for the students, and ensured the plan runs smoothly.
profile_positions.title: Activity Manager, First Years Weekend

profile_positions.description:
- Responsible for enhancing the social and academic life of the students of International Studies by organizing events (ranging from career-oriented workshops and guest lectures to informal get-togethers and parties)
- Improving cohesion between students from all programs at the university with the university administration and representing the interests of the students. 
- I coordinated with 26 committees and projects which organize events specific to interests, hobbies or social/academic lives of students. 
- Organising regular meetings with all the committees, approving event proposals and helping committees with logistics, booking university spaces for events, addressing concerns from committees, arranging Committee Heads meetings twice per semester, being the contact point between committees and the board and having weekly board meetings.
profile_positions.title: Internal Affairs Officer, BASIS Board

profile_positions.description:
- Organising training sessions every week for students interested in participating in Model UN conferences.
- Handling all social media for the committee, and devising new promotional strategies 
- Taking minutes of the meeting 
- Ensuring all committee members fulfil their weekly tasks
- Finding conferences (both abroad and within the Netherlands) that we could take a delegation to represent of WijnMUN. 
- I maintained the role of a faculty advisor for the delegation at these conferences and took responsibility for managing finances and organising administrative details.
profile_positions.title: Vice President of WijnMUN Committee

profile_positions.description:
- Work closely with the headquarters of UNICEF Nederland for awareness based and fundraising activities. 
- Organize events such as the annual City Roaming, charity fairs, guest lectures about topics such as Child Marriage, Female Genital Mutilation where we invite imminent speakers, documentary viewings, and sustainability related initiatives such as vintage clothing sales. 
- Leading the education committee by delegating tasks, setting deadlines and ensuring that said deadlines are fulfilled, recruitment of volunteers, documentation, staying in touch with the headquarters, looking for sponsors, and having regular meetings with the committee and with the Board. 
- Notable Project: Samen Hier Student Newcomer Community Project in collaboration with Justice and Peace Netherlands which put 2 university students and 2 refugee youth (or newcomers) in the Netherlands in “pods” of 4 for the span of 3 months to reduce isolation, increase dialogue and foster genuine friendships through a community sponsorship model.
profile_positions.title: Head Of Education Committee

profile_positions.description: My internship duties involved assisting project managers with spreading awareness about cancer (its types, about its treatment, about funding and more), as well as assisting with attaining financial aid - for those who couldn’t afford treatment - from donors or sponsors. I accompanied trained counsellors and psychologists on their hospital rounds as they gave support/counselling sessions for admitted patients and their family members. We also provided general assistance to cancer patients at public hospitals.
profile_positions.title: Project Intern

profile_positions.description: I shadowed and learned from Senior Editors of ScoopWhoop. As I learnt content writing and editing skills from them, I wrote 10 articles about versatile topics such as diet and health, sociopolitical protests and organizations, teenage psychology, literature etc. Five of these articles were published on their website later as well.
profile_positions.title: Summer Intern
